articles.title: Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Kujang Fish Farm
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Provides Field Guidance to Kujang Fish Farm 
						
Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il provided field guidance to the Kujang Fish Farm.
					After being briefed on the farm before a huge map showing its panoramic view, he went round various places of the fish farm including a hatching room to learn in detail about fish breeding there.
					
					Noting that the Kujang Fish Farm is the best place for fish breeding as it abounds in water resources and quality of water is good, he stressed that the fish farm ensuring profitability and equipped with cutting-edge facilities is the one desired by the WPK and capable of bringing the people substantial benefits.
					
					He set forth tasks to serve as guidelines for further developing the nation's fish farming.
					
					Fish breeding is a very economic production field as it ensures high profitability, while spending less money, and the shortest cut to providing people with fresh fish in all seasons, he said. 
					
					Noting that the country has very favorable conditions for breeding fish in a big way as it abounds in rivers, lakes, springs and hot springs, he called for continuously and energetically doing fish farming as a mass movement.
					
					He underlined the need to find out all right places for fish farming while making a good use of springs and hot springs and thus build more fish farms to make sure that every place where water is available teems with fish.
					
					He earnestly called on all fields and units to rapidly boost the fish production so that they can translate the lifetime ardent wish of President Kim Il Sung to provide the people with a sufficient quantity of fish into a reality as early as possible. 
					
					He was accompanied by Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Phyong Hae, U Tong Chuk and Ri Myong Su, senior officials of the party and armed forces organs, Hyon Chol Hae, department director of the NDC, and Ri Man Gon, chief secretary of the North Phyongan Provincial Committee of the WPK.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Niger
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets PM of Niger
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday sent a message of greetings to Brigi Rafini upon his appointment as prime minister of Niger.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in keeping with the desire of the two peoples, the message wished the prime minister success in his work for the stability and economic development of the country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae Meets American Reverend
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae Meets American Reverend
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Reverend Franklin Graham, president of Samaritan's Purse, a non-governmental organization of the United States, and his party at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Thursday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from American Reverend
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from American Reverend
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Reverend Franklin Graham, president of Samaritan's Purse, a non-governmental organization of the United States, on a visit to the DPRK. 
					 The gift was handed Thursday by the reverend to Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Mozambican PM and Party Leader on Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Mozambican PM and Party Leader on Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to Mozambique An Hui Jong paid a farewell call on Aires Ali, prime minister of the country, on May 4 and on Philipe Paunde, secretary general of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party, on May 3. 
					 The prime minister fully supported all the measures of the government of the DPRK to develop economy and improve the standard of the people's living and hoped that the Korean people would build a thriving nation at an early date. 
					
					 Mozambique extends support and solidarity to the DPRK government and the Korean people in their struggle to peacefully settle the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula and achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, he noted. The two countries have long maintained the good friendly relations, he said, expressing the hope that the bilateral exchange and cooperation would grow stronger.  
					
					 The secretary general of the party positively supported the Korean people in their just cause of national reunification, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the Mozambican Liberation Front Party and the Workers' Party of Korea would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Foreign Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Foreign guests visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace on Thursday to pay tribute to President Kim Il Sung.
					 They included the delegation of the Communist Party of Sweden led by Chairman Anders Karlsson, the delegation of the Mongolian Institute for Strategic Studies led by Director Damba Ganbat, the delegation of the Lao Federation of Trade Unions led by Vice-President Symuone Uonlasy and the delegation of the Press Chautari Nepal led by Chairman Gagan Bista.
					
					 They paid homage in profound reverence to the President who made immortal contributions to the accomplishment of the cause of global independence and the development of friendly relations among countries.

articles.title: Solidarity Meeting with Palestinian People Held
articles.content:
Solidarity Meeting with Palestinian People Held 
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A solidarity meeting was held at the DPRK-Palestine Friendship Pyongyang Tongdaewon Secondary School Thursday on the occasion of Day of Nakba of Palestine.
					 Present there on invitation were Ismail Ahmed Mohamed Hasan, Palestinian ambassador to the DPRK, and his embassy officials.
					
					 Present there were So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the DPRK-Palestine Friendship and Solidarity Committee, officials concerned and teachers of the school.
					
					The meeting extended full support and solidarity to the Palestinian people in their just cause to take back the territories occupied by Israel and recover the legitimate national rights including the establishment of an independent state.
					
					 The meeting adopted a letter to the chief of the Palestinian National Authority.
					
					 Then the participants enjoyed an art performance given by students.

articles.title: Radioactivity Observation Result Released
articles.content:
Radioactivity Observation Result Released
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- An observation result of radioactive fallouts from Japan's Fukushima atomic reactors was made public in the DPRK.
					 According to the result, very small amounts of iodine-131 and cesium-137 began to be detected in the air on around March 25. In early April the density of iodine-131 and cesium-137 detected from air samples rose to 0.37 and 0.19 micro Becquerel per cubic meter respectively. Their level dropped again after rainfalls in mid- and late April.
					
					 In early May their level remained low, 0.01 micro Becquerel per cubic meter.
					
					 The result shows that the water, plants and fishes in the east and west seas of Korea have not yet been affected by the nuclear accident.

articles.title: Dust Storms Observed Again
articles.content:
Dust Storms Observed Again
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Dust storms have been observed in the DPRK on Thursday.
					 The sand storms were churned up by winds in Gobi Desert and Inner Mongolia on Wednesday in consequence of a low atmospheric pressure over the central part of Mongolia and the following high pressure. They descended on the west coast of Korea and some areas of Jagang Province next day.
					
					 It is experts' view that all areas of the DPRK will be affected slightly by the storms from nighttime.
					
					 The latest storms are the second in May and fourth since the beginning of the year.

articles.title: Self-baking Electrode Producing Technology Developed
articles.content:
Self-baking Electrode Producing Technology Developed
 Pyongyang, May 12   (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians and workers in the field of metal industry of the DPRK developed the new technology of producing self-baking electrode by use of anthracite found in abundance in the country as its principal raw material and widely applied it to production. 
					 This is another signal turn in the development of metallurgical industry.
					
					 The technicians of the Puryong Alloy Iron Works conceived a unique technology of producing Korean style electrode, which can replace self-baking electrode made by use of coke and graphite, on the basis of the experience gained in the practice. As a result, they succeeded in developing the new technology of producing self-baking electrode with anthracite as basic raw material without going through heat treatment and the even mixing of materials by heat and mechanical processing. 
					
					 The above-said technology helps ensure very high economic profitability, prevent harmfulness and significantly improve working conditions. 
					
					 The processes which had been considered as essential for the production of self-baking electrode are no longer necessary, making the production process simple. 
					
					  The introduction of this technology made it possible to boost the productivity 8 to 10 times without using the electricity and fuel consumed for the heat treatment and the even material mixing. 
					
					 The above-said works is boosting the production by using the self-baking electrode made by itself for furnaces with various capacities. 
					
					 The officials and workers of the Posan Iron Works completely removed the existing production processes and applied the above-said method into production. 
					
					 The Chongjin Steel Works solved scientific and technological issues including the issues of rational composition and mixing rate and additives for raising the mechanical quality of self-baking electrode and cutting down its non-resistance. A work is making brisk headway at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex and the Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex to apply the above-said technology.

articles.title: Functional Cosmetics Enjoy Popularity
articles.content:
Functional Cosmetics Enjoy Popularity
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Unhasu-trademarked chitosan lotion and hair cream produced by the Pyongyang Cosmetics Factory are popular among local people.
					 Ri Kyong Ae, a 31-year-old employee of the Korea Publications Import and Export Company, told KCNA that she has long used the lotion to find that it has no side effect but prevents black spots and pimples and makes skin fair.
					
					 Kim Sun Jong, a 33-year-old member of Pyongyang Joint Program Development Center, said the cream keeps hair springy and elastic.

articles.title: Talented Football Coach
articles.content:
Talented Football Coach
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Ri Chang Hun, a football coach of the Pyongyang Sports Team, has done much for the development of women's football in the country. 
					 He, 59, has trained a lot of footballers over nearly 30 years. 
					
					 Among them are Jo Song Ok, Sin Kum Ok, Kim Song Hui and Ri Jin Ok who played a big role when the DPRK team won the 13th and 14th Asian Women's Football Championships and 3rd FIFA U-20 Women′s World Championship. 
					
					 Ri has a special flair in selecting players and training them. 
					
					 His team won local tournaments several times.

articles.title: Chonju Temple in Yaksandongdae
articles.content:
Chonju Temple in Yaksandongdae
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Chonju Temple is one of the tourist attractions in the northwestern area of Korea.
					 The temple in Yaksandongdae of Nyongbyon County, North Phyongan Province, was built in 1684 and rebuilt in 1722.
					
					 It had several buildings but now only Pogwang Shrine, Chonju Pavilion and an accessory building still remain.
					
					 The temple was regarded as a point of military importance. Near the temple is a ruined arsenal.
					
					 The shrine, with a crane-shaped roof and double eaves, was colorfully painted. 
					
					 The pavilion has a large loft in the middle, flanked by two other lofts connected with living rooms for nuns.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts US Policy of Overseas Aggression
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts US Policy of Overseas Aggression
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The president of the World Peace Council, addressing the second peace seminar for the dismantlement of military bases overseas, described U.S. President Barack Obama as the new face of its war expansionism.
					 It exposed once again that the U.S. policy of hegemony which has been pursued historically has been invariably carried forward by the 44th administration and the American president is the chief executor of the government's policy of overseas aggression.
					
					 The U.S. has about 850 military bases in 135 countries and it is responsible for 43 percent of military spending worldwide.
					
					 No country in the world has so many military bases overseas as the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. has stationed its huge troops in the Asia-Pacific region under the pretext of coping with the "attack to the south" by the Soviet Union in the period of the Cold War. But it has steadily increased the number of military strongholds in that region and hastened the forward-deployment of U.S. forces even now when the Cold War is over and it has no military rivals.
					
					 The main thrust of the U.S. Asia strategy is to ward off the influence of other big powers upon this region, contain the expansion of the sphere of their forces and establish a U.S. style order of domination over it by force of arms.
					
					 South Korea and Japan are outposts for carrying out the U.S. Asia strategy and the forward-deployment of U.S. forces is used as a military lever for its implementation.
					
					 The U.S. claims that a lot of military bases set up by it in Kuwait, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, Qatar, Oman, the United Arab Emirates and other Middle East regions are aimed to beat back the possible aggression from Iran and ensure the security of the oil transport route.
					
					 In the middle of the 1990s the U.S. set up its military facilities in Hungary, Albania, Bosnia-Herzegovina, Macedonia and Southern Kosovo under the pretext of peace-keeping and humanitarian activities.
					
					 The U.S. set up at least 19 new military bases after the September 11, 2001 incident.
					
					 Latin America is no exception as far as the issue of U.S. military bases is concerned.
					
					 The U.S. put five air force bases and two naval bases of Colombia under its control under the pretext of "helping it in anti-drug operations and those to rout anti-government troops." It is set to deploy more than 1 400 personnel and lots of arms and equipment there. U.S. military bases are operating in El Salvador, Honduras, Panama, Costa Rica, etc.
					
					 Many U.S. military bases whose number is on the steady increase in various countries and regions are unanimously chided by the international community for being advanced bases for realizing its ambition for world domination.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Abolishing Old International Economic Order
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Abolishing Old International Economic Order
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Developing countries which entered into the new stage of development in the 21st century are calling for the earliest abolition of the old order in the field of international economy.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday observes this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is very important and urgent for the non-aliened and other developing countries to abolish the old international economic order at present. 
					
					 The imperialists are pursuing a policy aimed at gaining their own profits by sacrificing the interests of developing countries through a crafty use of different levers under the above-said order. Consequently, resources and results of labor of developing countries are sold to the capitalist countries at giveaway prices. 
					
					 The Western countries are imposing various unreasonable conditionalities upon the goods being exported to developing countries, availing themselves of their economic and technical advantages. Because of imperialists' artifices the prices of the primary products from those countries are steadily dropping in world markets. 
					
					 The United States is amalgamating or absorbing banks of developing countries in reliance upon the old international monetary system and putting raw material resources, means of production, etc. under its control. By doing so it prevents these countries from building an independent national economy. 
					
					 Developing countries can neither develop economy nor get rid of the imperialists' economic subjugation, exploitation and plunder as long as the old international economic order remains in force.
					
					 Only when the old international economic order is abolished to put an end to inequality, violation of sovereignty and exploitation and plunder of other countries in the international economic relations, is it possible to guarantee the socio-economic progress of the developing countries and provide conditions for world stability. 
					
					 The DPRK will wage a dynamic struggle to abolish the old international economic order and build instead a fair new one in the idea of independence, peace and friendship and thus contribute to advancing global independence, concludes the article.

articles.title: Halt to Four Large Rivers Projects Demanded by German Expert
articles.content:
Halt to Four Large Rivers Projects Demanded by German Expert
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A German expert on river on May 4 sent a letter to the executive director of the UN Environment Programme demanding a halt to the four large rivers projects of the south Korean authorities, according to south Korean MBC.
					 He in the letter branded the projects as very irresponsible work as they lack an academic reason in the light of river engineering and ecosystem.
					
					 I do not understand how the south Korean "government" will preserve ecology while conducting the projects, he said, adding that it is the only right decision to stop the projects only seeking to bring profits to the construction business.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Ulterior Intention to Strengthen Dictatorial System Disclosed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Ulterior Intention to Strengthen Dictatorial System Disclosed
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore in an editorial on May 7 disclosed the aim sought by the authorities in the recent Cabinet reshuffle.
					 The reshuffle made by Lee Myung Bak on May 6 is nothing but a farce to escape criticism as it was quite contrary to what was called for by the people through the April 27 by-election, the editorial said.
					
					 Those ministers who must be ousted according to the will of the people stay in their offices, it said, adding that an example of this is Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 Hyon's resignation brooks no further delay as he brought the inter-Korean relations to collapse while talking about "north's collapse," it noted.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak let Won Se Hun stay in office as director of the Intelligence Service. This indicates that he is keen to strengthen the dictatorial system with his confidants around him in a bid to maintain his power in the closing years of his office.

articles.title: Meeting of Koreans in Japan Held to Help Eradicate Aftermath of Quake
articles.content:
Meeting of Koreans in Japan Held to Help Eradicate Aftermath of Quake 
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Koreans in Miyagi Prefecture, Japan was held at Tohoku Korean Primary and Middle School on April 29 to help eradicate the aftermath of the massive earthquake and the ensuing tsunami as early as possible. 
					 Attending there were officials of the Miyagi Prefectural Headquarters of the Central Emergency Measure Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, compatriots in the prefecture and members of Chongryon organizations of different parts of Japan.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					Ri Yong Sik, chairman of the Miyagi Prefectural Headquarters of the said committee, called upon the compatriots in the prefecture to rehabilitate the school and bring the living of the Korean community to normal at an early date with the support of compatriots of different parts, inspired by the relief fund sent by General Secretary Kim Jong Il with his loving care.
					
					 Pae Man Sok, chairman of the Miyagi Prefectural Commercial Association, said:  We have the homeland, organizations and compatriots, evincing his will to take the lead in the work to recover from the quake damage.
					
					 Ryu Han Song, chairman of the Miyagi Prefectural Youth Commercial Association, said that he would work hard for rehabilitation, noting that now is the time to devote everything to it.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Abduction of Inhabitants of DPRK Slammed in Ecuador
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Abduction of Inhabitants of DPRK Slammed in Ecuador
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The Ecuador-Guaranda Institute for Friendship and Cultural Solidarity with the Korean People issued a statement on May 4 denouncing the south Korean puppet group for committing such unethical act as kidnapping inhabitants of the DPRK in the West Sea of Korea.
					 Recalling that the south Korean authorities unreasonably abducted a fishing boat and 31 inhabitants of the DPRK and put them in custody for more than 50 days and have not sent four of them back to the north, the statement bitterly denounced this brutal action. 
					
					 These atrocities reveal once again the bestial nature of the south Korean authorities abusing human rights as servants of the imperialists, it said, and went on:
					
					 The south Korean authorities should stop the provocative moves against the DPRK and come out for dialogue for peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We strongly demand the U.S. forces withdraw from south Korea at once and send the inhabitants of the DPRK back to the north.

articles.title: China's Police Chief Calls for Building Upright and Honest Police Ranks
articles.content:
China's Police Chief Calls for Building Upright and Honest Police Ranks 
						
 Beijing, May 10 (KCNA) -- Minister of Public Security of China Meng Jianzhu, who is a state councilor, at a recent meeting called for building upright and honest police ranks.
					 He underscored the need to faithfully fulfill the solemn pledge to remain police for people's security under the new historic conditions and thus build upright and honest police ranks which may satisfy the people and greet the 90th anniversary of the foundation of the Communist Party of China with a fresh image.
					
					 He urged the leaderships of the public security organs at different levels and their leading officials to create a good police atmosphere by effectively strengthening the party discipline and enforcing a clean-handed policy.

articles.title: China Reiterates Its Stance to Boost Relations with African Union
articles.content:
China Reiterates Its Stance to Boost Relations with African Union
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Ce Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, called for steadily boosting the Sino-African Union relations on a new stage at the 4th China-African Union Strategic Dialogue in Addis Ababa recently.
					 He expressed the will of China to boost the high-ranking visits, round off the system for dialogue, expand cooperation and make closer the coordination and cooperation with the AU in dealing with the regional and international issues.
					
					 He said that China would as ever continue to support the efforts of the AU to achieve the regional peace, stability and development.

articles.title: Head of Palestinian National Authority on Importance of National Unity
articles.content:
Head of Palestinian National Authority on Importance of National Unity
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Head of the Palestinian National Authority Mahmoud Abbas at a meeting Sunday referred to the importance of national unity.
					 National unity is the best way to build the Palestinian independent state and achieve peace, he noted.
					
					 "We are ready to resume peace negotiations if the Israeli government accepts the peace references and halts settlement construction," he declared.

articles.title: International Seminar Calls for Dismantlement of Foreign Military Bases
articles.content:
International Seminar Calls for Dismantlement of Foreign Military Bases 
						
 Havana, May 10 (KCNA) -- An international seminar calling for the dismantlement of foreign military bases was held in Cuba recently.
					 It brought together delegates of 36 countries.
					
					 The participants strongly denounced the U.S. for its military intervention as it killed many civilians in Iraq and Afghanistan and brought unspeakable sufferings to them.
					
					 A final declaration adopted at the seminar condemned the U.S. for not closing its naval base prison in Guantanamo but keeping their military bases in Latin America and other parts of the world.

articles.title: Positive Movement for Establishment of Independent State of Palestine
articles.content:
Positive Movement for Establishment of Independent State of Palestine
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- Talks between Fatah and Hamas were held in Egypt on April 27.
					 At the talks the two sides reached a preliminary agreement on all the issues raised including the election and the issue of establishing a provisional government.
					
					 Then they signed a final agreement on reconciliation at the talks held on May 4.
					
					 The signing of the agreement between the two factions this time helped the Palestinians created a new environment for advancing to achieve their common aim by their concerted efforts.

articles.title: War Victory Day Celebrated in Commonwealth of Independent States
articles.content:
War Victory Day Celebrated in Commonwealth of Independent States
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The 66th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War was celebrated in the Commonwealth of Independent States.
					 An event celebrating the war victory day took place at the square in front of "Eternal Flame" of Belarus on May 9. Then followed a mass demonstration.
					
					 Present there was Belorussian President Aleksandr Lukashenko.
					
					 Military parades took place in Ukraine and Kyrgyzstan and ceremonies of laying wreaths before the monuments to fallen fighters of the Soviet Army and meetings were held in Kazakhstan and Azerbaijan.

articles.title: ADB Calls upon Asian Countries to Boost Cooperation
articles.content:
ADB Calls upon Asian Countries to Boost Cooperation
						
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- The president of the Asian Development Bank at the recent meeting of the board of governors called upon the Asian countries to strengthen cooperation among them.
					 He underscored the need for the Asian countries to realize the further deepened economic integration through their cooperation.
					
					 Closer south-south cooperation in the region would not only help achieve economic growth in Asia but contribute to the world economy, he added.

articles.title: Parliamentary Election Held in Singapore
articles.content:
Parliamentary Election Held in Singapore
 Pyongyang, May 12 (KCNA) -- A parliamentary election was held in Singapore on May 7.
					 The ruling People's Action Party won 81 of the 87 seats in the parliamentary election, according to the returns of the election.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige la Piscifactoría de Kujang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige la Piscifactoría de Kujang 
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, dirigió sobre el terreno la Piscifactoría de Kujang. 
					Tras escuchar las explicaciones ante el plano, recorrió varios lugares incluso la sala de incubación para hacer conocimiento detallado de la cría de peces. 
					
					La piscifactoría de Kujang es el terreno muy apropiado a la cría de peces por sus abundantes fuentes de agua de buena calidad, dijo y agregó que esta empresa de alto rendimiento dotado de equipos sofisticados es el criadero que deseaba el PTC y puede beneficiar al pueblo. 
					
					El Dirigente presentó las tareas que servirán de guía para desarrollar la piscicultura del país.
					
					La piscicultura es una rama de producción de alto rendimiento que requiere pocos fondos, afirmó y precisó que esto es el remedio más eficiente para suministrar a los habitantes mucho más pescados frescos en todas las estaciones. 
					
					Nuestro país con muchos ríos, lagos, fuentes y aguas termales tiene las condiciones favorables a dinamizar la piscicultura, destacó y subrayó la necesidad de hacer esta labor como un movimiento masivo. 
					
					Deben aprovechar activamente los manantiales y las fuentes termales y al mismo tiempo, aumentar el número de los criaderos de peces al encontrar todos los terrenos apropiados para que por doquier del país abunden los peces, enseñó.
					
					Encomendó encarecidamente que todas las ramas y unidades deben aumentar vertiginosamente la producción de pescados para satisfacer cuanto antes el anhelo del Presidente Kim Il Sung quien se había esforzado tanto durante su vida por suministrar suficientes pescados a los habitantes. 
					
					Le acompañaron en esta ocasión los cuadros directivos de los organismos del partido y de las fuerzas armadas, Ri Yong Ho, Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Jong Gak, Kim Phyong Hae, U Tong Chuk y Ri Myong Su, el jefe de departamento del CDN, Hyon Chol Hae, y el secretario responsable del Comité del PTC en la Provincia de Phyong-an del Norte, Ri Man Gon.

articles.title: Kim Yong Dae se reúne con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
articles.content:
Kim Yong Dae se reúne con Franklin Graham y su comitiva
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea, Kim Yong Dae, departió este jueves en el Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con el pastor estadounidense Franklin Graham, presidente de la organización no gubernamental "Samaritan´s Purse", y su comitiva, quienes le hicieron una visita de cortesía.

articles.title: Premier mozambiqueño se refiere a relaciones de amistad con la RPDC
articles.content:
Premier mozambiqueño se refiere a relaciones de amistad con la RPDC
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- An Hui Jong, embajador coreano acreditado en Mozambique, hizo el día 4 una visita de despedida al primer ministro mozambiqueño, Aires Ali, y el día 3 al secretario general del Partido de Frente de Liberación de Mozambique (PFLM), Philipe Paunde.
					En la audiencia, el premier expresó apoyo activo a todas las medidas del gobierno de la República Popular Democrática de Corea por desarrollar la economía del país y mejorar la vida del pueblo y deseó que el pueblo coreano construya cuanto antes la gran potencia próspera.
					
					Se solidarizó con la lucha del gobierno de la RPDC y el pueblo coreano por solucionar por vía pacífica el problema nuclear de la Península Coreana y lograr la reunificación independiente y pacífica del país.
					
					Señaló que los dos países tienen excelentes relaciones de amistad de largo tiempo y expresó esperanza de que se amplíen y se desarrollen más el intercambio y la cooperación de ambos países.
					
					Philipe Paunde manifestó su apoyo irrestricto a la justa causa del pueblo coreano por la reunificación del país y deseó que se fortalezcan y se desarrollen aun más las relaciones de amistad y cooperación entre el PFLM y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea.

articles.title: CRPP denuncia palabras provocativas de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
CRPP denuncia palabras provocativas de Lee Myung Bak 
						
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con respecto a que el traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak soltó las palabras provocativas contra la República Popular Democrática de Corea durante su reciente visita a Alemania, el portavoz del Comité por la Reunificación Pacífica de la Patria (CRPP) dio el día 11 la siguiente respuesta a la pregunta de la ATCC:
					El día 8, el traidor Lee convocó en ese país germano, primer destino de su gira por Europa, la charla con compatriotas, la conferencia de prensa, etc., en las cuales demandó a la República Popular Democrática de Corea la "renuncia nuclear", diciendo que las armas nucleares de ésta obstaculizan la reunificación. 
					
					Además, señaló que ésta debe "pedir disculpas" por el incidente del hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan" y el caso de cañonazo en la isla Yonphyong y habló de la "represalia a la provocación" de alguien, pretextando los complots anti-RPDC cometidos en el pasado.
					
					En particular, se atrevió a censurar el régimen norcoreano y persiguió la confrontación de sistemas Norte-Sur preconizando la barrera de Berlín. 
					
					Esto es una grave provocación al sistema y la dignidad de la RPDC y una burla intolerable a los ingentes esfuerzos de la RPDC por el diálogo y a la opinión pública interna y externa. 
					
					No estando satisfecho con su campaña anti-reunificación en el Sur de Corea, el traidor Lee suelta palabras provocativas hasta en otros países con el fin de romper el cada día más creciente ambiente de diálogo, evadir las censuras por la ruptura de las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas y el fracaso de su "política sobre el Norte" y justificar su alboroto nuclear y sus maniobras conflictivas contra la RPDC. 
					
					Fijar como llave del diálogo Norte-Sur la "disculpa" de la RPDC por el incidente de "Cheonan" y el caso de la isla Yonphyong y presentar como premisa del diálogo la "renuncia nuclear" de alguien, es la malsana intención de la banda de títeres surcoreanos de enfrentarse hasta el final con la RPDC y desarmarla y realizar junto con EE.UU. la ambición de nueva agresión a ésta. 
					
					Sobre todo, intentar la importación del modo de reunificación de otro país es una ilusión vana igual a esperar la caída del cielo. 
					
					La Península Coreana no es Alemania. 
					
					La banda de títeres surcoreanos espera una "situación de cambio repentino" como en Alemania, pero, realmente, ocurrieron no en el Norte, sino en el suelo surcoreano las contingencias como la Sublevación del 19 de Abril y se sustituyó varias veces el "poder". 
					
					Es muy ridículo que hable de la apertura de la Cumbre Nuclear Lee Myung Bak, lacayo de EE.UU. en sus maniobras de guerra nuclear, quien ha convertido el suelo surcoreano en el mayor arsenal nuclear y base avanzada de guerra nuclear. 
					
					Al tomar el poder, ese traidor declaró la política de obediencia a EE.UU. y de confrontación fratricida diciendo que no le importaría la suspensión del diálogo Norte-Sur durante su mandato. Todo el mundo lo recuerda claramente. 
					
					Dado que se hicieron evidentes su declaración y su decisión de hacer enfrentamiento con la RPDC, nos vemos obligados a considerar seriamente la posición que manteníamos hasta ahora. 
					
					Es muy obvio que no podríamos lograr nada en la mesa del diálogo con los enloquecidos por la confrontación fratricida y por la ambición nunca realizable. 
					
					No perdonaremos ni en lo mínimo a los que insultan y burlan la dignidad y el régimen de la RPDC, sino les haremos frente rotundo y despiadado. 
					
					El enfrentamiento de los regímenes no traerá nada más que la guerra. 
					
					La guerra, que se desate en este territorio, será una contienda sagrada y justa para la reunificación de la patria. 
					
					El traidor Lee Myung Bak debe actuar con prudencia observando bien el temperamento de la RPDC y la realidad.

articles.title: Corea publica el resultado de observación de radiación ambiental
articles.content:
Corea publica el resultado de observación de radiación ambiental
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- Recientemente, la República Popular Democrática de Corea publicó el resultado de observación de radiaciones de medio ambiente desde el incidente de la Central Nuclear de Fukushima ocurrida el 12 de marzo pasado hasta la fecha.
					  Según eso, a eso del día 25 de marzo comenzaron a analizar poca cantidad del yodo131y el cesio 137 en capa atmosférica.
					
					  A principios de abril, en la zona noroeste del país el yodo 131 y el cesio 137 fueron de 0.37mBq y de 0.19mBq por cada metro cúbico  de aire, respectivamente. Y la densidad llegó al máximo y cayó al suelo por las lluvias de mediados y finales de abril.
					
					  A principios de este mes el yodo 131 y el cesio 137 fueron de menos de 0.01mBq por cada metro cúbico de aire y bajaron casi 1/1000 en comparación con que llegaron al máximo.
					
					  Según el resultado de análisis sobre agua, plantas y peces marítimas en el Mar Este y el Oste de Corea, no tiene la eficacia del incidente nuclear de Japón.

articles.title: Nuevo fenómeno de polvos amarillos arenosos en Corea
articles.content:
Nuevo fenómeno de polvos amarillos arenosos en Corea
Pyongyang, 12 de mayo (ATCC) -- El día 12, se observaron otra vez en Corea los polvos amarillos arenosos.
					Este fenómeno natural ocurrido en el desierto de Gobi y la zona de Mongolia interior de China por la influencia de la depresión atmosférica, extendida el día 11 en la parte central de Mongolia, y por la alta presión siguiente, fue detectado hoy por la tarde en las zonas costeras del Mar Oeste y en algunas localidades de la provincia de Jagang.
					
					Los especialistas pronostican que desde la noche este fenómeno afectará poco a la mayor parte del país. 
					
					Este fenómeno se detecta por cuarta vez este año.
